sentence.Network_en: Daytime television tended to remind her too forcefully of her own situation.
sentence.Network_cn: 日间电视节目往往使她深刻地认识到自身的境况。

sentence.Network_en: Mr Pearson said he knew nothing of his wife's daytime habits.
sentence.Network_cn: 皮尔逊先生说，他对妻子白天的生活习惯一无所知。

sentence.Network_en: Please give a daytime telephone number.
sentence.Network_cn: 请留一个日间的电话号码。

entry.def: The daytime is the part of a day between the time when it gets light and the time when it gets dark.

example.ex: In the daytime he stayed up in his room, sleeping, or listening to music...
example.tran: 他白天呆在自己的屋子里睡觉或听音乐。

example.ex: Please give a daytime telephone number...
example.tran: 请留一个日间的电话号码。

entry.tran: (电视或广播节目周一至周五)白天播出的，日间播放的
entry.def: Daytime television and radio is broadcast during the morning and afternoon on weekdays.

example.tran: 独立电视台的新一整套日间档节目

means.word_mean: 1. the time after sunrise and before sunset while it is light outside;

sentences.sentence: "it is easier to make the repairs in the daytime"

means.word_mean: 1. happening during or appropriate to the day;

stems_affixes.word_buile: day日,日子+ly表副词或形容词等→daily每日的[地]→日报

stems_affixes.word_buile: every每一的+day日,日子→每天的→日常的→平常的→平凡的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 每日, 日常地, 天天

day日,日子+ly表副词或形容词等→daily每日的[地]→日报

day日,日子+break破晓→n.黎明, 拂晓

day日,日子+time时间→n.白天, 日间

sentences.en: Bats sleep in the daytime and come out to hunt for food at night.
sentences.cn: 蝙蝠白天睡觉, 而夜间出来觅食。
